comments: Lamb (IND) and Ball (CHA) come together at the same spot off-ball and marginal body contact occurs.
Ball (CHA) brushes Brogdon's (IND) left arm as Brogdon is passing the ball and marginal contact occurs.
Plumlee (CHA) and Sabonis (IND) engage and disengage with one another during rebounding.
Bridges (CHA) delivers contact to Sabonis' (IND) back following the rebound and dislodges him from his position.

Brogdon (IND) cleanly dislodges Hayward (CHA) of the ball as simultaneous marginal contact occurs to Hayward's front. Craig's (IND) forearm is rested on Hayward's back and marginal contact occurs simultaneously with the dislodge.
Bridges (CHA) swipes forward and marginal contact occurs with Craig's (IND) right wrist as they each attempt to retrieve the loose ball.

Craig's (IND) foot remains in bounds as he makes contact with the ball. After batting the ball away, he steps out of bounds and re-establishes himself in bounds before making contact with the ball again.
Bridges (CHA) and Lamb (IND) engage and disengage with one another off-ball.
Ball (CHA) establishes himself in a screening position in Craig's (IND) path and absorbs the contact.
Brogdon (IND) wraps Hayward's (CHA) upper half and affects his FOM off-ball.
Ball (CHA) and Duarte (IND) make incidental contact with one another during rebounding.
Lamb (IND) cleanly dislodges Oubre Jr. (CHA) of the ball prior to incidental arm contact occurring. Following the dislodge, Lamb and Oubre Jr. make incidental foot-to-foot contact with one another.
The ball is last touched by the Pacers before going out of bounds.  The Hornets retain possession.
Plumlee (CHA) establishes himself in a screening position in Craig's (IND) path and absorbs the contact.
Hayward (CHA) and Craig (IND) engage and disengage with one another during the inbound.
Craig's (IND) left arm is extended toward Hayward (CHA) and marginal contact occurs with Hayward's arm/front during the drive.
Sabonis (IND) jumps toward Hayward (CHA) and marginal body contact occurs as Hayward passes the ball at the end of the drive.
Bridges (CHA) gathers the ball on his right foot and takes two steps before attempting the shot.
Sabonis (IND) jumps toward Bridges (CHA) and marginal body contact occurs during Bridges' driving shot attempt.
Sabonis' (IND) hands are rested on Plumlee's (CHA) back and marginal contact occurs as Sabonis releases away to pursue the rebound.
Ball (CHA) grabs and pulls Craig's (IND) jersey, affecting Craig's ability to retrieve the rebound and subsequently causing the contact between Ball and Sabonis (IND) to occur.
Lamb (IND) swipes forward and marginal contact occurs with Hayward's (CHA) side/arm.
Ball (CHA) and Duarte (IND) come together at the same spot along the perimeter and, as the defensive switch takes place during the pick, marginal body contact occurs.
Craig (IND) jumps alongside Hayward's (CHA) path and marginal contact occurs with Hayward's side during his upward shooting motion.
Sabonis (IND) and Hayward (CHA) make incidental arm contact with one another during rebounding.
Craig (IND) and Plumlee (CHA) make incidental arm contact with one another during rebounding.
Sabonis (IND) makes clean contact with the ball and dislodges it away from Plumlee (CHA) before incidental contact occurs to Plumlee's lower body.
Bridges (CHA) brushes Craig's (IND) left forearm and marginal contact occurs following the rebounding sequence.
Washington (CHA) establishes himself in a screening position in Holiday's (IND) path and absorbs the contact.
Duarte's (IND) arm is extended outward into Hayward's (CHA) path and marginal contact occurs to Hayward's front after his gather.

Washington (CHA) extends his arms forward and marginal contact occurs with Duarte's (IND) arms and head during rebounding. Contact to an opponent?s head/face can be deemed marginal when the result of a natural basketball move, provided the contact is not disproportionate or uncontrolled.
Hayward (CHA) cleanly dislodges Duarte (IND) of the ball during rebounding.
Brogdon (IND) makes clean contact with the ball and dislodges it away from Hayward (CHA).
Craig (IND) initiates contact across Washington's (CHA) left arm during his upward shooting motion.
Washington (CHA) moves alongside Sabonis' (IND) path and absorbs the marginal body contact that occurs during the drive.
Washington (CHA) establishes himself in a legal guarding position and marginal contact occurs with Sabonis (IND) as he fades away during the shot attempt.
